body_html: iirc prior to Backend<Type>Tensor we had two separate declarations for bernoulli_, one that operated on CUDA Tensors and one for CPU Tensors --> allowing us to manually specify arguments as being THFloatTensor* vs. THCudaTensor* etc. When I unified the declaration so that it could be bound by ATen, I made it BackendFloatTensor and then in the cwrap code I handle substituting in the appropriate type. The original PR is here: #2578

body: iirc prior to `Backend<Type>Tensor` we had two separate declarations for `bernoulli_`, one that operated on CUDA Tensors and one for CPU Tensors --> allowing us to manually specify arguments as being `THFloatTensor*` vs. `THCudaTensor*` etc. When I unified the declaration so that it could be bound by ATen, I made it `BackendFloatTensor` and then in the `cwrap` code I handle substituting in the appropriate type. The original PR is here: https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/pull/2578
